title: NASA weighing continuing VERITAS versus future Discovery mission
summary: Budget pressures in NASA’s planetary science program could force the agency to choose between continuing a mission to Venus that has already been delayed or requesting proposals for a future mission.

title: Intelsat buys capacity on Hispasat’s Amazonas Nexus satellite
summary: Intelsat has acquired a “significant amount” of capacity from the recently launched Amazonas Nexus satellite to meet demand for connectivity over the Americas, an executive for the company told SpaceNews.

title: FCC unveils proposed satellite direct-to-device regulatory framework
summary: The U.S. Federal Communications Commission unveiled its proposed framework March 17 for regulating the use of terrestrial wireless spectrum from space for connecting smartphones beyond the reach of cell towers.

title: ULA Completes Vulcan Tanking Test, WDR Next
summary: The United Launch Alliance (ULA) team has completed the next phase of testing in preparation for the inaugural Vulcan rocket flight.

title: SpaceX conducts doubleheader with Starlink mission followed by launch for SES
summary: Hot on the heels of Tuesday’s successful CRS-27 launch, SpaceX’s Falcon 9 was in action again for a pair of back-to-back missions from both coasts Friday, tasked with deploying communications satellites into orbit.

title: Arianespace wins Vega contract for Italian imaging satellite constellation
summary: In a vote of confidence for a troubled launch vehicle, Arianespace won a contract from the Italian government for up to three Vega C launches of an Earth observation constellation.

title: China launches second classified Gaofen-13 remote sensing satellite
summary: China added its initially civilian Gaofen Earth observation series Friday with the launch of the classified optical geostationary Gaofen-13 (02) satellite.

title: SpaceX launches Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral at sunset
summary: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket launched from Cape Canaveral just after sunset Friday on mission to haul two SES television broadcasting satellites into orbit, continuing a multibillion-dollar program to clear C-band spectrum for terrestrial broadband. The mission took off at 7:38 p.m. EDT (2338 GMT), just four hours after the launch of another Falcon 9 from California.

title: Electron launches two Capella Space radar satellites
summary: Rocket Lab launched its second Electron rocket from Virginia March 16, placing two Capella Space radar imaging satellites into orbit.

title: NASA selects Axiom Space for third private astronaut mission to ISS
summary: NASA has approved plans by Axiom Space to fly a third private astronaut mission to the International Space Station as soon as November, although with no details yet about who will go on the flight.
